Class TemplateConfigUtil

TemplateConfigUtil - Utility class for loading template engine and template library configurations.

Created on Jul 27, 2006

Author:
Dave

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

readTemplateEngineConfig

public static TemplateEngineConfig readTemplateEngineConfig()
                                                     throws TemplateException
readTemplateEngineConfig - Read the default template engine xml configuration, or return it if it has already been created.

First, it looks for DEFAULT_ENGINE_CONFIG in the current directory. If it does not find it there, then it looks for it on the classpath. If it still cannot find the file, then it uses the default values for TemplateEngineConfig.

This method returns a copy of the default TemplateEngineConfig that is safe to modify for your own needs.

WARNING: If you are not planning to modify the the returned TemplateEngineConfig, then you should not use this method and should use TemplateEngine.createInstance() instead.

Returns:
A copy of the default TemplateEngineConfig, suitable for modification.
Throws:
TemplateException
See Also:
DEFAULT_ENGINE_CONFIG, TemplateEngineConfig, ClassLoaderUtil

readTemplateEngineConfig

public static TemplateEngineConfig readTemplateEngineConfig(java.lang.String filename)
                                                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                            TemplateException
readTemplateEngineConfig w/String - Read a template engine xml configuration from a file.

This is a convenience method and is equivelent to:

   readTeplateEngineConfig(new FileInputStream(filename))

Parameters:
filename - The name of the file to read.
Returns:
A template engine configuration suitable for instantiating a TemplateEngine class.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException
TemplateException
java.lang.NullPointerException - if filename == null
See Also:
readTemplateEngineConfig(InputStream)

                                                            TemplateException

This is a convenience method and is equivelent to:

readTemplateEngineConfig

public static TemplateEngineConfig readTemplateEngineConfig(java.io.InputStream stream)
                                                     throws TemplateException
readTemplateEngineConfig w/InputStream - Read a template engine xml configuration from an InputStream.

Parameters:
stream - The InputStream to read.
Returns:
A template engine configuration suitable for instantiating a TemplateEngine class.
Throws:
TemplateException - This method uses JAXB to parse the xml configuration. If JAXB throws an exception, this method catches it and re-throws it as a wrapped TemplateException.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if stream == null

readTemplateLibConfig

public static TemplateLibConfig readTemplateLibConfig(java.io.File applicationRoot,
                                                      TemplateEngineConfig.UseLib useLib)
                                               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                      TemplateException
readTemplateLibConfig w/File, UseLib - Read a template library xml configuration, using a UseLib library specification object and an applicationRoot.

This method is used by the Template Engine to resolve libraries and is probbaly not very useful for the general pbulic.

Parameters:
applicationRoot - A java.io.File representing the application root. null is Okay.
useLib - The UseLib specification to load the template library from.
Returns:
A template library configuration suitable for adding to a template engine configuration.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException
java.lang.NullPointerException - if useLib == null
TemplateException
See Also:
TemplateEngineConfig.UseLib, TemplateEngineConfig
